Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE
Description: Small conical vase, the mouth of which is topped with a convex lip; it is coated with a thick brick-red slip which gives it a shiny and smooth appearance. It is generally considered as intended to contain a measure of beer.
